title: ArchEyes | Architecture and Design Magazine
description: ArchEyes brings you a carefully edited selection of Architecture projects, news, and competitions for the architecture professional.

title: Archinect
description: The goal of Archinect is to make architecture more connected and open-minded, and bring together designers from around the world to introduce new ideas from all disciplines.

title: Archiobjects Magazine
description: An architecture magazine focused on architecture, interiors and branding. Founded by Luca Onniboni in 2013.

title: The Architect’s Newspaper
description: The most authoritative voice on architecture and design in the United States.

title: The Architectural Review
description: The only global architecture magazine for the 21st century. Be inspired and provoked by incisive critiques and the thinking behind the buildings shaping architectural discourse.

title: Architecture News & Buildings | The Architects' Journal
description: Architecture news, the latest building designs and essential updates for architects, from the UK’s leading professional architecture magazine.

title: ART and ARCHITECTURE, mainly
description: History, art history and architecture of Britain & Empire, Europe, Mediterranean & North America, 1640-1940.

title: Buildings of New England
description: Exploring New England and showcasing amazing architecture and history one building at a time!

title: declad
description: I am an architect with over twenty years experience working in different countries. I am British but I live in Helsinki.

title: Destroyed and Abandoned
description: Pics of destroyed and abandoned things. Disasters, destruction, explosions, blasts, misfortunes,...

title: Drawing Matter
description: Exploring the role of drawing in architectural thought and practice.

title: Irenebrination
description: Notes on Architecture, Art, Fashion, Fashion Law & Technology.

title: Municipal Dreams
description: Municipal Dreams celebrates the efforts and achievements of our early municipal reformers.

title: OSArch
description: Creating a built environment with free software, increased transparency, and a more ethical approach.
